cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow, then curl north-northwest tonight and turn north-northeast Wednesday, tracking across the eastern Gulf toward the Florida Big Bend and then across northern FL into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key / Apalachee Bay

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from Tampa Bay northward to the Big Bend, then Atlantic coast of Georgia and the Carolinas later in the period
weather_observation.wind: Breezy with a small (≤9%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusts to near 35 mph possible Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Miami (Atlantic) side; surge threat confined to Florida Gulf Coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5‒10 inches of rain possible across the Florida peninsula including Miami with isolated totals up to 15 inches, bringing risk of urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along the southeast Florida beaches and a low tornado risk in outer rain-bands.
